result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Vallin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury AMENDED from Attempt 2nd degree intentional homicide [Modifiers: Use of Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 04-24-2017:   Sentence from July 1, 2016 is hereby vacated.  Defendant to be resentenced by another court.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

supervisions.notes:
PRIOR SENTENCE VACATED 04/11/2017.
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 20 years bifurcated sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Continue education and obtain HSED.  Seek and maintain full-time employment.  Participate in vocational services if appropriate.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations, including DNA surcharge.  All costs and fees are to be paid during term of extended supervision and not deducted from inmate account.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Not to possess any body armor.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.
Costs waived except for Victim/Witness surcharge and DNA surcharge.
